event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Increment PMSWINC Register
event.description: The counter increments on writes to the PMSWINC register

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: Counts any instruction fetch which misses in the cache. This does not count; cache maintenance instructions and non-cacheable accesses.

event.title: L1 Instruction TLB
event.name: Refill
event.description: This event counts any refill of the L1 instruction TLB from the MMU Translation Cache (MMUTC). This includes refills that result in a translation fault. TLB maintenance instructions are not counted. This event counts regardless of whether the MMU is enabled.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: This event counts any load or store operation or translation table walk access which causes data to be read from outside the L1, including accesses which do not allocate into L1. The following instructions are not counted; Cache maintenance instructions and prefetches, Stores of an entire cache line, even if they make a coherency request outside the L1, Partial cache line writes which do not allocate into the L1 cache and Non-cacheable accesses. This event counts the sum of 'L1 Data Cache: Refill (due to read)' and 'L1 Data Cache: Refill (due to write)'.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: This event counts any load or store operation or translation table walk access which looks up in the L1 data cache. In particular, any access which could count the 'L1 Data Cache: Refill' event causes this event to count. The following instructions are not counted; Cache maintenance instructions and prefetches and Non-cacheable accesses. This event counts the sum of 'L1 Data Cache: Access (due to read)' and 'L1 Data Cache: Access (due to write)'.

event.title: L1 Data TLB
event.name: Refill
event.description: This event counts any refill of the data L1 TLB from the MMUTC. This includes refills that result in a translation fault. TLB maintenance instructions are not counted. This event counts regardless of whether the MMU is enabled.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Load
event.description: The counter increments for every executed memory-reading instruction

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Store
event.description: The counter counts each architecturally-executed memory-writing instruction. DC ZVA is counted as a store. The counter does not count a Store-Exclusive instruction that fails.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: All
event.description: The counter increments for every architecturally executed instruction

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: Taken
event.description: The counter increments for each exception taken

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Exception Returns
event.description: The counter increments for each executed exception return instruction

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Write to CONTEXTIDR
event.description: The counter increments for every write to the CONTEXTIDR

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Write to PC
event.description: The counter increments for every software change of the PC. This includes all: Branch instructions, memory reading instructions that explicitly write to the PC, Data processing instructions that explicitly write to the PC, and Exception return instructions.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Immediate)
event.description: The counter counts all immediate branch instructions that are architecturally executed

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Return)
event.description: The counter counts all procedure return instructions that are architecturally executed

event.title: Branch Predictor
event.name: Mispredictions
event.description: The counter counts each correction to the predicted program flow that occurs because of a misprediction from, or no prediction from, a change in control flow that the branch prediction resources are capable of predicting

event.title: Cycles
event.name: CPU Cycles
event.description: The counter increments on every cycle

event.title: Branch Predictor
event.name: Possible Predictions
event.description: The counter counts every branch or other change in the program flow that the branch prediction resources are capable of predicting

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access
event.description: This event counts memory accesses due to load or store instructions. The following instructions are not counted; Instruction fetches, Cache maintenance instructions, Translation table walks or prefetches. This event counts the sum of 'Memory: Access (due to read)' and 'Memory: Access (due to write)'.

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: This event counts any instruction fetch which accesses the L1 instruction cache or MOP cache. The following instructions are not counted; cache maintenance instructions, non-cacheable accesses.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Write-back
event.description: The counter counts every write-back of data from the Level 1 data or unified cache. The counter counts each write-back that causes data to be written from the Level 1 cache to outside of the Level 1 cache.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: This event counts any transaction from L1 which looks up in the L2 cache, and any writeback from the L1 to the L2. Snoops from outside the core and cache maintenance operations are not counted.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill
event.description: This event counts any cacheable transaction from L1 which causes data to be read from outside the core. L2 refills caused by stashes into L2 are not counted.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Write-back
event.description: This event counts any write-back of data from the L2 cache to outside the core. This includes snoops to the L2 which return data, regardless of whether they cause an invalidation. Invalidations from the L2 which do not write data outside of the core and snoops which return data from the L1 are not counted.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access
event.description: This event counts for every beat of data transferred over the data channels between the core and the Snoop Control Unit (SCU). If both read and write data beats are transferred on a given cycle, this event is counted twice on that cycle. This event counts the sum of 'Bus: Access (due to read)', 'Bus: Access (due to write)', and any snoop data responses.

event.title: Errors
event.name: Memory
event.description: Local memory error This event counts any correctable or uncorrectable memory error (ECC or parity) in the protected core RAMs

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: All
event.description: Operation speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Write to TTBR
event.description: The counter counts writes to the translation table base registers, TTBR0 and TTBR1

event.title: Cycles
event.name: Bus Cycles
event.description: Bus cycles This event duplicates 'Cycles: CPU Cycles'

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Allocation without refill
event.description: L2 data cache allocation without refill. This event counts any full cache line write into the L2 cache which does not cause a linefill, including write-backs from L1 to L2 and full-line writes which do not allocate into L1.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Any)
event.description: Instruction architecturally executed, branch This event counts all branches, taken or not. This excludes exception entries, debug entries and CCFAIL branches.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (Mispredicted)
event.description: Instruction architecturally executed, mispredicted branch This event counts any branch counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Any)' which is not correctly predicted and causes a pipeline flush

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend
event.description: No operation issued because of the frontend. The counter counts on any cycle when there are no fetched instructions available to dispatch.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend
event.description: No operation issued because of the backend The counter counts on any cycle fetched instructions are not dispatched due to resource constraints

event.title: L1 Data TLB
event.name: Access
event.description: Level 1 data TLB access This event counts any load or store operation which accesses the data L1 TLB. If both a load and a store are executed on a cycle, this event counts twice. This event counts regardless of whether the MMU is enabled.

event.title: L1 Instruction TLB
event.name: Access
event.description: Level 1 instruction TLB access This event counts any instruction fetch which accesses the instruction L1 TLB. This event counts regardless of whether the MMU is enabled.

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Access
event.description: Attributable L3 cache access This event counts for any cacheable read transaction returning data from the SCU, or for any cacheable write to the SCU

event.title: L2 Data/Unified TLB
event.name: Refill
event.description: Attributable L2 TLB refill This event counts on any refill of the MMUTC, caused by either an instruction or data access. This event does not count if the MMU is disabled.

event.title: L2 Data/Unified TLB
event.name: Access
event.description: Attributable L2 TLB access This event counts on any access to the MMUTC (caused by a refill of any of the L1 TLBs). This event does not count if the MMU is disabled.

event.title: Data TLB
event.name: Translation table walk
event.description: Access to data TLB that caused a page table walk This event counts on any data access which causes 'L2 Data/Unified TLB: Refill' to count

event.title: Instruction TLB
event.name: Translation table walk
event.description: Access to instruction TLB that caused a translation table walk. This event counts on any instruction access which causes 'L2 Data/Unified TLB: Refill' to count.

event.title: Last Level Cache
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: Last level cache access, read If CPUECTLR. EXTLLC is set, then this event counts any cacheable read transaction which returns a data source of interconnect cache. If CPUECTLR. EXTLLC is not set, then this event is a duplicate of the L*D_CACHE_RD event corresponding to the last level of cache implemented 'L2 Data Cache: Access (due to read)' if only one is implemented, or 'L1 Data Cache: Access (due to read)' if neither is implemented.

event.title: Last Level Cache
event.name: Miss (due to read)
event.description: Last level cache miss, read If CPUECTLR. EXTLLC is set, then this event counts any cacheable read transaction which returns a data source of DRAM, remote, or inter-cluster peer. If CPUECTLR. EXTLLC is not set, then this event is a duplicate of the L*D_CACHE_REFILL_RD event corresponding to the last level of cache implemented 'L2 Data Cache: Refill (due to read)' if only one is implemented, or 'L1 Data Cache: Refill (due to read)' if neither is implemented.

event.title: Multi-socket Remote Access
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'Multi-socket Remote Access: Access' that is a memory-read operation

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Miss (due to long-latency read)
event.description: Level 1 data cache long-latency miss

event.title: Operations
event.name: Executed
event.description: Micro-operation architecturally executed

event.title: Operations
event.name: Speculated
event.description: Micro-operation speculatively executed

event.title: Stalls
event.name: All
event.description: No operation sent for execution

event.title: Stalls (Slots)
event.name: Backend
event.description: No operation sent for execution on a slot due to the backend

event.title: Stalls (Slots)
event.name: Frontend
event.description: No operation sent for execution on a slot due to the frontend

event.title: Stalls (Slots)
event.name: All
event.description: No operation sent for execution on a slot

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: This event counts any load operation or page table walk access which looks up in the L1 data cache. In particular, any access which could count the 'L1 Data Cache: Refill (due to read)' event causes this event to count. The following instructions are not counted; cache maintenance instructions and prefetches, non-cacheable accesses.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: This event counts any store operation which looks up in the L1 data cache. In particular, any access which could count the 'L1 Data Cache: Refill (due to write)' event causes this event to count. The following instructions are not counted; cache maintenance instructions and prefetches, non-cacheable accesses.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to read)
event.description: This event counts any load operation or page table walk access which causes data to be read from outside the L1, including accesses which do not allocate into L1. The following instructions are not counted; xache maintenance instructions and prefetches, non-cacheable accesses.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to write)
event.description: This event counts any store operation which causes data to be read from outside the L1, including accesses which do not allocate into L1. The following instructions are not counted; cache maintenance instructions and prefetches, stores of an entire cache line, even if they make a coherency request outside the L1, partial cache line writes which do not allocate into the L1 cache, non-cacheable accesses.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (from inside cluster)
event.description: As 'L1 Data Cache: Refill', but counts only memory operations that generate refills satisfied by transfer from another cache inside of the immediate cluster

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (from outside cluster)
event.description: As 'L1 Data Cache: Refill', but counts only memory operations that generate refills satisfied by transfer from another cache outside of the immediate cluster

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: L2 cache access, read. This event counts any read transaction from L1 which looks up in the L2 cache. Snoops from outside the core are not counted.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: L2 cache access, write. This event counts any write transaction from L1 which looks up in the L2 cache or any write-back from L1 which allocates into the L2 cache. Snoops from outside the core are not counted.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to read)
event.description: This event counts any cacheable read transaction from L1 which causes data to be read from outside the core. L2 refills caused by stashes into L2 should not be counted. Transactions such as ReadUnique are counted as read transactions, even though they can be generated by store instructions.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to write)
event.description: This event counts any write transaction from L1 which causes data to be read from outside the core. L2 refills caused by stashes into L2 should not be counted. Transactions such as ReadUnique are not counted as write transactions.

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: This event counts for every beat of data transferred over the read data channel between the core and the SCU

event.title: Bus
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: Bus access write This event counts for every beat of data transferred over the write data channel between the core and the SCU

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: This event counts memory accesses due to load instructions. The following instructions are not counted; instruction fetches, cache maintenance instructions, translation table walks, prefetches.

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (due to write)
event.description: This event counts memory accesses due to store instructions. The following instructions are not counted; instruction fetches, cache maintenance instructions, translation table walks, prefetches.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Store-Exclusive (Failures)
event.description: The counter counts Store-Exclusive instructions speculatively executed that fail to complete a write. It is within the IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED definition of speculatively executed whether this includes conditional instructions that fail the condition code check.

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Store-Exclusive
event.description: The counter counts Store-Exclusive instructions speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Load
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only memory-reading instructions, as defined by the 'Instructions (Executed): Load' event

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Store
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only memory-writing instructions, as defined by the 'Instructions (Executed): Store' event

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Load/Store
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only memory-reading and memory-writing instructions, as defined by the 'Instructions (Executed): Load' and 'Instructions (Executed): Store' events

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Data Processing (Integer)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only integer data-processing instructions

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Data Processing (Advanced SIMD)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only Advanced SIMD data-processing instructions

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Data Processing (Floating-point)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only floating-point data-processing instructions

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (software PC writes)
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only software changes of the PC

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Crypto
event.description: As 'Instructions (Speculated): All', but the counter counts only Cryptographic instructions, except PMULL and VMULL

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (immediate)
event.description: The counter counts immediate branch instructions speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (return)
event.description: The counter counts procedure return instructions speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Branch (indirect)
event.description: The counter counts indirect branch instructions speculatively executed. This includes software change of the PC other than exception-generating instructions and immediate branch instructions.

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: IRQ
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions taken locally that are IRQ or Virtual IRQ exceptions

event.title: Exceptions
event.name: FIQ
event.description: As 'Exceptions: Taken', but counts only those exceptions taken locally that are FIQ or Virtual FIQ exceptions

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to read)
event.description: As 'L3 Data Cache: Access', but counts only attributable memory-read operations that cause a cache access to at least the Level 3 data or unified cache

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to read)
event.description: As 'L3 Data Cache: Refill', but counts only attributable memory-read operations that cause a refill of at least the Level 3 data or unified cache from outside the Level 3 cache

event.title: Stalls (Backend)
event.name: Memory Stall Cycles
event.description: No operation sent due to the backend and memory stalls

event.title: L1 Instruction Cache
event.name: Miss (due to long-latency read)
event.description: L1 instruction cache long latency miss

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Miss (due to long-latency read)
event.description: L2 cache long latency miss

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Miss (due to long-latency read)
event.description: L3 cache long latency miss

event.title: PMU
event.name: Overflows (EL1, EL0)
event.description: PMU overﬂow, counters accessible to EL1 and EL0

event.title: Trace buﬀer
event.name: Trigger Event
event.description: The event is generated when a Trace Buﬀer Extension Trigger Event occurs

event.title: PMU
event.name: Overflows (EL2)
event.description: PMU overﬂow, counters reserved for use by EL2

event.title: Latency
event.name: Access with additional latency from alignment
event.description: Access with additional latency from alignment

event.title: Latency
event.name: Load with additional latency from alignment
event.description: Load with additional latency from alignment

event.title: Latency
event.name: Store with additional latency from alignment
event.description: Store with additional latency from alignment

event.title: MTE
event.name: Checked data memory access
event.description: Checked data memory access

event.title: MTE
event.name: Checked data memory access, read
event.description: Checked data memory access, read

event.title: MTE
event.name: Checked data memory access, write
event.description: Checked data memory access, write

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: SVE
event.description: The counter counts each Instruction architecturally executed SVE instruction

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: SVE
event.description: SVE operations speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Floating Point, Half-Precision (all)
event.description: Half-precision floating-point operation speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Floating Point, Single-Precision (all)
event.description: Single-precision floating-point operation speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Floating Point, Double-Precision (all)
event.description: Double-precision floating-point operation speculatively executed

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Integer, 8-bit (Advanced SIMD and SVE)
event.description: Operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Integer (Advanced SIMD and SVE)' where the largest type is 8-bit integer

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Integer, 16-bit (Advanced SIMD and SVE)
event.description: Operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Integer (Advanced SIMD and SVE)' where the largest type is 16-bit integer

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Integer, 32-bit (Advanced SIMD and SVE)
event.description: Operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Integer (Advanced SIMD and SVE)' where the largest type is 32-bit integer

event.title: Instructions (Speculated)
event.name: Integer, 64-bit (Advanced SIMD and SVE)
event.description: The counter counts each operation counted by 'Instructions (Speculated): Integer (Advanced SIMD and SVE)' where the largest type is an 64-bit integer

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (indirect branch taken excluding returns)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by both 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (indirect branch)' and 'Instructions (Executed): Write to PC', that is not counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Return)'. These are all indirect branch instructions, excluding return instructions, on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is taken.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (predicted immediate branch)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by both 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Immediate)' and 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (predicted branch)'. These are all direct branch instructions on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is correctly predicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (mispredicted immediate branch)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by both 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Immediate)' and 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Mispredicted)'. These are all direct branch instructions on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is mispredicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (predicted procedure return)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (predicted indirect branch)' where if taken, the branch would be counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Return)'. These are all return instructions on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is correctly predicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (mispredicted procedure return)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (mispredicted indirect branch)' where if taken, the branch would also be counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Return)'. These are all return instructions on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is mispredicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (predicted indirect branch, excluding return)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (predicted indirect branch)' where if taken, the branch would not be counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Return)'. These are all indirect branch instructions, excluding return instructions, on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is correctly predicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (mispredicted indirect branch, excluding return)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (mispredicted indirect branch)' where if taken, the branch would not be counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Return)'. These are all indirect branch instructions, excluding return instructions, on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is mispredicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (predicted branch)
event.description: The counter counts each instruction counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Any)' that is not counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Mispredicted)'. These are all branch instructions on the architecturally executed path, where the branch is correctly predicted.

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Branch (indirect branch)
event.description: The counter counts each Software change of the PC that is not counted by 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (Immediate)'. Software change of the PC has the same definition as for the 'Instructions (Executed): Write to PC' and 'Instructions (Executed): Branch (branch not taken)' events. Note: conditional branches are always counted, regardless of whether the branch is taken.

event.title: Event Latency
event.name: Instruction Fetch
event.description: Event in progress, 'Memory: Access (due to instruction fetch)'

event.title: Event Latency
event.name: Memory (Read)
event.description: Event in progress, 'Memory: Access (due to read)'

event.title: Memory
event.name: Access (due to instruction fetch)
event.description: Instruction memory access

event.title: Event Latency
event.name: Bus (Read)
event.description: Bus read transactions in progress

event.title: Event Latency
event.name: DTLB Walk
event.description: Event in progress, 'Data TLB: Translation table walk'

event.title: Event Latency
event.name: ITLB Walk
event.description: Event in progress, 'Instruction TLB: Translation table walk'

event.title: Data TLB
event.name: Hardware update of translation table
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Data TLB: Access' that causes a hardware update of a translation table entry

event.title: Instruction TLB
event.name: Hardware update of translation table
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Instruction TLB: Access' that causes a hardware update of a translation table entry

event.title: Data TLB
event.name: Translation table walk, step
event.description: The counter counts each translation table walk access made by a refill of the data or unified TLB

event.title: Instruction TLB
event.name: Translation table walk, step
event.description: The counter counts each translation table walk access made by a refill of the instruction TLB

event.title: Data TLB
event.name: Large page translation table walk
event.description: The counter counts each translation table walk counted by 'Data TLB: Translation table walk' where the result of the walk yields a large page size

event.title: Instruction TLB
event.name: Large page translation table walk
event.description: The counter counts each translation table walk counted by 'Instruction TLB: Translation table walk' where the result of the walk yields a large page size

event.title: Data TLB
event.name: Small page translation table walk
event.description: The counter counts each translation table walk counted by 'Data TLB: Translation table walk' where the result of the walk yields a small page size

event.title: Instruction TLB
event.name: Small page translation table walk
event.description: The counter counts each translation table walk counted by 'Instruction TLB: Translation table walk' where the result of the walk yields a small page size

event.title: Data TLB
event.name: Demand access, at least one table walk
event.description: Data TLB demand access with at least one translation table walk. The counter counts each demand access counted by 'L1 Data TLB: Demand access' that causes a refill or update of a data or unified TLB involving at least one translation table walk access.

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Hardware prefetch
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L1 Data Cache: Access' that is due to a hardware prefetch. The hardware prefetch is generated by a hardware prefetcher at the Level 1 data or unified cache.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Hardware prefetch
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L2 Data Cache: Access' that is due to a hardware prefetch. The hardware prefetch is generated by a hardware prefetcher at the Level 2 data or unified cache.

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Hardware prefetch
event.description: The counter counts each access counted by 'L3 Data Cache: Access' that is due to a hardware prefetch. The hardware prefetch is generated by a hardware prefetcher at the Level 3 data or unified cache.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Memory Bound)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Frontend' when no instructions are delivered from the memory system. This includes the cycles counted by 'Stalls: Frontend (Level 1 instruction cache)', 'Stalls: Frontend (Last level PE cache or memory)' and 'Stalls: Frontend (TLB miss)'.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Level 1 instruction cache)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Frontend (Memory Bound)' when there is a demand instruction miss in the L1 instruction cache. If the complex is conﬁgured with a per-complex L2 cache, this event does not count if 'Stalls: Frontend (Last level PE cache or memory)' counts. If the complex is not conﬁgured with a per-complex L2 cache, this event is not implemented.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Last level PE cache or memory)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Frontend (Memory Bound)' when there is a demand instruction miss in the last level of cache within the PE clock domain or a non- cacheable instruction fetch in progress. If the complex is conﬁgured with a per-complex L2 cache, this event is based on L2 cache misses. If the complex is not conﬁgured with a per-complex L2 cache, this event is based on L1 instruction cache misses.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (TLB miss)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Frontend (Memory Bound)' when there is a demand instruction miss in the instruction or unified TLB

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Processor bound)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Frontend' when the frontend is stalled on a frontend processor resource, not including memory. This includes the cycles counted by 'Stalls: Frontend (Flow control)' and 'Stalls: Frontend (Flush recovery)'.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Flow control)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Frontend (Processor bound)' when the frontend is recovering from a ﬂush

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Frontend (Flush recovery)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Frontend (Processor bound)' when the frontend is recovering from a ﬂush

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Memory bound)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend' when the backend is waiting for a memory access to complete. This includes the cycles counted by 'Stalls: Backend (Level 1 data cache)', 'Stalls (Backend): Memory Stall Cycles', 'Stalls: Backend (Interlock, Store)' and 'Stalls: Backend (TLB)'.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Level 1 data cache)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend (Memory bound)' when there is a demand data miss in the L1 data cache. If the complex is conﬁgured with a per-complex L2 cache, this event does not count if 'Stalls (Backend): Memory Stall Cycles' counts. If the complex is not conﬁgured with a per-complex L2 cache, this event is not implemented.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (TLB)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend (Memory bound)' when there is a demand data miss in the L1 data TLB

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, Store)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend (Memory bound)' when the backend is stalled waiting for a store

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Backend busy)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend' when operations are available from the frontend but the backend is not able to accept an operation because an execution unit is busy

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock)
event.description: The counter counts each cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend' when operations are available from the frontend but at least one is not ready to be sent to the backend because of an input dependency

event.title: Bus
event.name: Bus request, read
event.description: The counter counts each transaction counted by 'Bus: Bus request' that is a Memory-read operation

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to hardware prefetch)
event.description: The counter counts each hardware prefetch counted by 'L1 Data Cache: Hardware prefetch' that causes a refill of the Level 1 data or unified cache from outside of the Level 1 data or unified cache

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to hardware prefetch)
event.description: The counter counts each hardware prefetch counted by 'L2 Data Cache: Hardware prefetch' that causes a refill of the Level 2 data or unified cache, or any Level 1 data, instruction, or unified cache of this PE, from outside of those caches

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Write Streaming Mode
event.description: Level 2 cache write streaming mode

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Enter Write Streaming Mode
event.description: Level 1 data cache entering write streaming mode

event.title: L1 Data Cache
event.name: Write Streaming Mode
event.description: Level 1 data cache write streaming mode

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Write Streaming Mode
event.description: Level 3 cache write streaming mode

event.title: Last Level Cache
event.name: Write Streaming Mode
event.description: Last level cache write streaming mode

event.title: L2 Data/Unified TLB
event.name: Access (Last Level Walk)
event.description: Level 2 TLB last-level walk cache access

event.title: L2 Data/Unified TLB
event.name: Refill (Last Level Walk)
event.description: Level 2 TLB last-level walk cache refill

event.title: L2 Data/Unified TLB
event.name: Access (IPA)
event.description: Level 2 TLB IPA cache access

event.title: L2 Data/Unified TLB
event.name: Refill (IPA)
event.description: Level 2 TLB IPA cache refill

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Stash Dropped
event.description: Level 2 cache stash dropped

event.title: L1 Data/Unified TLB
event.name: Refill
event.description: L1D TLB reﬁll due to ETS replay. This event counts any reﬁll counted by 'L1 Data TLB: Refill' due to ETS replay.

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to spatial prefetcher)
event.description: This event counts any refill counted by 'L2 Data Cache: Refill (due to hardware prefetch)' caused by L2 spatial prefetcher

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to L2 offset prefetcher)
event.description: This event counts any refill counted by 'L2 Data Cache: Refill (due to hardware prefetch)' caused by L2 offset prefetcher

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to L2 pattern prefetcher)
event.description: This event counts any refill counted by 'L2 Data Cache: Refill (due to hardware prefetch)' caused by the L2 pattern prefetcher

event.title: L2 Data Cache
event.name: Refill (due to L2 TLB prefetcher)
event.description: This event counts any refill counted by 'L2 Data Cache: Refill (due to hardware prefetch)' caused by the L2 TLB prefetcher

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to L3 stride prefetcher)
event.description: This event counts any access counted by 'L3 Data Cache: Hardware prefetch' caused by the L3 stride prefetcher

event.title: L3 Data Cache
event.name: Access (due to L3 offset prefetcher)
event.description: This event counts any access counted by 'L3 Data Cache: Hardware prefetch' caused by the L3 offset prefetcher

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, AGU)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, input dependency, address This event counts every cycle counted by 'Stalls: Backend (Interlock)', where there is an input dependency on an address operand. This type of interlock is caused by a load/store instruction waiting for data to calculate the address.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, VPU)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, interlock, VPU

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (VPU Hazard)
event.description: No operation issued due to the backend, VPU hazard. This event counts cycles where the core stalls due to contention for the VPU with the other core.

event.title: Stalls
event.name: Backend (Interlock, Issue Slot)
event.description: Issue slot not issued due to interlock

event.title: Instructions (Executed)
event.name: Re-executed (due to read-after-read hazard)
event.description: This event counts each instruction which re-executes due to read-after-read hazard

event.title: Data TLB
event.name: Translation table walk (due to hardware prefetch)
event.description: This event counts any access counted by 'Data TLB: Translation table walk' that is due to a hardware prefetch
